title: Review of Jürgen Hocker, Encounters With Conlon Nancarrow, translated by Steven Lindberg (Lexington Books, 2012)

author_info.name: Robert Willey
author_info.address: School of Music, Ball State University, Muncie, IN 47306

citations.cowell_1930: Cowell, Henry. 1930. New Musical Resources . New York: Alfred Knopf.
citations.gann_1995: Gann, Kyle. 1995. The Music of Conlon Nancarrow . Cambridge: Cambridge University Press.
citations.estrada_2012: Estrada, Julio. 2012. Telephone interview with Robert Willey. Personal interview. Lafayette/Mexico City, August 15.
citations.hocker_2002: Hocker, Jürgen. 2002. Begegnungen mit Conlon Nancarrow . Mainz: Schott Music.
citations.nancarrow_1977: Nancarrow, Conlon. 1977. Studies for Player Piano: the Original 1750 Arch Recordings. San Francisco: Other Minds, 1012/1015-2.

FN1.text: 1. The subheadings contained in this table of contents give an overview of the subjects covered in the book.

FN2.text: 2. The Paul Sacher Foundation is an international research center specializing in twentieth and twenty-first century composers and performers. They moved all of Nancarrow’s papers and instruments from Mexico City to their facility in Switzerland in 1997.

FN3.text: 3. A picture of Nancarrow at his drafting table can be seen on Hocker’s website.

FN4.text: 4. Hocker, Jürgen. “Player Piano Music” YouTube channel, 2010. http://www.youtube.com/user/playerpianoJH .
